intro: Haplostephium granmogolense, commonly known as the granmogolense lichen, is a member of the Parmeliaceae family. It is a foliose lichen that typically grows on tree bark in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a complex thallus structure composed of a fungal matrix and algal symbionts. Its morphology includes a leathery, leaf-like appearance with a distinctive coloration. The botanical significance of Haplostephium granmogolense lies in its ecological role and its use in lichenological research.
